intro: Artemisia woodii, commonly known as the "ghost plant," is a rare and unique species of flowering plant. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its woody stems and aromatic foliage. Native to the high altitudes of the Sierra Madre mountains in Mexico, it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with narrow, gray-green leaves and small yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Artemisia woodii is considered a rare and endangered species.
